title: Reasonable Ahri Nerf Idea
body:
Don't grant her the move speed bonus from using her Q - Orb of Deception if she doesn't hit an enemy champion with it . This would not affect the good Ahri players that consistently land their Q ability but would punish the bad Ahri players that make mistakes and give her more room for failure and would give her opponents more room to punish her as well . This is similar to a recent nerf that Darius received in which they nerfed the hilt damage of his Q - Decimate not affecting his blade damage . Thoughts ?


Edit: Wow this thread is blowing up ! I did not expect this to happen as this is like my first post on the Boards ever . Thanks guys ! {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

Please, for the love of god, just rework her. As an Ahri main, it breaks my heart to see them straying so far away from the badass "Kiss of Death" fantasy that suits her to a T. They've done EVERYTHING to avoid it, from removing the damage amp to even removing the ability to stop DASHES. Ahri's current iteration's playstyle is  just land a q or 2 in lane and then r in and spam q and w. Charm is completely out of the equation. I very rarely need charm to secure kills. Ahri's ult was  designed to land her charm and curve her q. Just make the charm a little more relevant, please. Assassin Ahri > Mage Ahri. At least when I killed someone as assassin ahri, I felt like i had outplayed the enemy and earned the kill.

I agree.  The best course of action is to revert the 5.2 insult of a rework and return skill to her gameplay. The Kiss of Death interaction was the best thing that ever happened to her and needs returned.

The Kiss of Death interaction was never her original design OR playstyle. It only came into existance when DFG became a thing, and they had to balance a mobile mage, into a mobile Assassin, who relied on DFG, for kills. Mage Ahri is much more healthier for the game, because getting hit by charm no longer means insta-death, not until Middle and late game. It gives room for outplaying early game, as it lengthens her kill time, so even if they get hit by charm, they can still respond. 

The type of gameplay I see people wanting is like Syndra gameplay. You want to hit a target with your CC, and kill them before they can respond. That's all and well, but you can't have that on a Mobile mage early game, someone whose able to reposition, flank, and escape from tricky situations real fast. The only reason that existed during DFG times, is because they kept Ahri's bases low, forcing her to rely on hitting Charm and DFG, which lead to binary gameplay of "Did I hit charm? No: Well now I'm useless". 

Other mages, mobile or not, don't have to rely on hitting their CC to up the rest of their damage. It makes it easier to hit their combo, but not hitting a Xerath stun doesn't make his Q do less damage. That's the entire purpose of Ahri's charm, to make the rest of her damage more reliable, not do more damage. It allows a skilled Ahri to still kill someone, even if they miss their Charm, it just takes longer and forces the Ahri player to rely more on skill to hit both parts of Q without Charm helping them.

A rework is _completely_ unneeded. Besides, have you seen the recent _"reworks"_? They already almost fucked her new lore, don't need to risk completely destroying her gameplay too, her QER are too iconic to her.

I'm sorry, I don't mean this towards you in particular, but the whole "This will not effect good players/will effect bad players" feels like such a freaking buzzword nowadays. First of all, it's not hard to hit Q, it's really not. At the same time, Q doesn't hit hard enough to warrant the gating of a secondary effect. 

Secondly, if you hit Charm, you already get the reliable damage from Q and the enemy's inability to respond. Q having MS on Hit isn't going to help anything post that, you've already done your thing. You could argue "What if someone got right on Ahri's tails", but that doesn't matter either, since their point freaking blank, you're going to hit Q regardless. 

Lastly, Q is balanced around it's damage to allow the MS. To gate it, you're also going to need to up the damage. But like said before, Q is pretty easy to hit, especially when Charmed. So now, you have an easy to hit spell, with more damage, with a kit that already makes it really freaking easy to hit it, and a Charm. So, realistically, nothing has changed, and you've now given Ahri more damage with lowers her time to kill.

Her Q would need more damage to compensate if this was designed to be a zero sum change. It is clearly not. This is a nerf to a champion with a 54% win rate and 20% play rate. Ahri is played a lot and doesn't really suffer from it because she's a little strong and doesn't have many bad matchups.
When people can come up with a better argument than just winrate for nerfing Ahri, I'll get behind plain nerfs.

"Just Winrate"? 

She has a 20% play rate and is hurting champion diversity, which I personally think is an issue in itself but at very least is indicative of an issue.

She doesn't have enough of a skill curve. She has above 50% win rate at every level of champion and game experience from 0-200 games and Bronze up. 

She doesn't have any bad matchups. The only midlaners who can statistically be considered counters aren't even that strong of counters, because TF has the best winrate against her with 52.07%.

This can't be considered part of the current meta because Ahri has been in almost the exact same spot balance wise since her soft rework ages ago.

With all this I don't think she needs any hard hits because there are definitely bigger balance issues out there, and she isn't that toxic to play against. This is why doing a small nerf like this is a good idea because the only impact it would have is knocking her down one peg from the throne she has been on for years.
Ahri didn't have a ms boost on her q or amp on her e when she was released. I don't even remember why they add it to her in the first place.
the movement speed was added because she needed to feel thematic as a dashing trickster assassin. her focus used to be all on movement speed.
Didn't they also add it as a compensation buff for the E nerf as well?

I see people suggest this one a lot, and I don't feel like it'd be a good change simply because of its usability. It would create a variable amount of time where she would have the MS boost that would feel awkward to use. Either the MS boost stays the same but only on hit (MS while the orb travels) which would make the MS boost unreliable and shorter even if you hit it, as if the enemy you hit is max range you would get the boost late _and_ the duration would be halved. Or if you only hit on the return the duration would be very small, etc. 

Alternatively, it's given a static duration even if the orb returns to her which would still have a similar problem where it's unreliable even if you hit it or not depending on the enemy's distance relative to Ahri. Enemy is too far when you need it ASAP and you don't get it until its too late, enemy is too close and you no longer can redirect the orb as smoothly because the MS ran out mid flight.

While it _is_ a nerf, I feel as though it's a clunky solution and there are better alternatives.
